thread.title: Life insurers' new premium grows by 13.8% in April-August period
thread.title_full: Life insurers' new premium grows by 13.8% in April-August period | Business Standard News

author: BS Reporter
title: Life insurers' new premium grows by 13.8% in April-August period
text:
New business premiums of life insurance companies saw a 13.8 per cent rise for the period between April 1, 2015 to August 31, 2015, on back of strong growth by private life insurers.. As per the data released by the Insurance Regulatory and Development Authority of India (IRDAI), life insurers collected first year premium of Rs 45,871.05 crore for the period as compared to Rs 40,296.52 crore collected in same period previous fiscal.
Private life insurers saw a growth of 27 per cent and collected new premiums of Rs 13434.15 crore for the period. They registered a strong growth in all segments including individual single, individual non-single, group single and group non-single.
The country's largest insurer Life Insurance Corporation of India (LIC) saw a growth of 9.2 per cent collecting new premiums of Rs 32,436.90 crore for the period, on the back of healthy growth in group single premium. However, LIC saw a decline in growth in individual single, group non-single and non-single premium segments for the period.
